results.title: Storm in a teacup
results.creator_credit: Stuart McDonald and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Cecil is retired and enjoying the twilight of his life. Freida is a widow who enjoys spending time at the local swimming pool, especially after she meets Cecil. Cecil and Freida soon become intimate companions (much to the amusement of some of Cecil’s mates from the croquet club), and Cecil becomes determined to fulfil his life-long dream of sailing to New Zealand - but is it too late? This film captures the essence of a generation who have plenty of time to enjoy themselves and is a positive look at senior citizens which illustrates that “old age” is really only as old as you feel!

results.title: Storm
results.creator_credit: Steve French and Second Banana Films
results.brief_description: The fluid boundaries between love and hate in human affairs are given concrete form in this inventive animation as figures are continually metamorphosed to the Jazz classic ‘Stormy weather’.

results.title: Stories
results.brief_description:
Shows children working with a teacher and making up a round-robin collaborative story, formulating characters, illustrating how they get ideas, and the importance of settings, beginnings and endings.
Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Stop or go: an experiment in genetics
results.creator_credit: Bert Shapiro and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: A documentation of an experiment which successfully analysed the genetic code of a mutant virus. Dr Norton Zinder and his colleagues at Rockefeller University, New York City, are shown as they separate the mutant viruses from non-mutants, grow new generations of the mutants, extract the mutants’ genetic materials, and test whether or not this material will manufacture a certain protein known as the coat protein.

results.title: Stop laughing, this is serious
results.creator_credit: John Power and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: A survey of the Australian newspaper cartoon tradition from the 1880’s up to the late 1960’s. Shows many examples of Australian artists’ work, some of which are famous throughout the world. Today’s cartoonists: Emile Mercier, George Molnar, Bruce Petty and Les Tanner discuss their work, struggles and aspirations. Narrated by Frank Legg, music by Don Burrows.

results.title: Stonehenge. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Philip Owtram, Richard Stratford and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: A view of Stonehenge which is rooted in hard evidence and sound deduction. The film views the monument as it stands today, reconstructs, with models, the monument as it was and the likely method of erection. Also makes clear the symmetry and orientation of the structure, shows a midsummer sunrise and discusses the possible significance of this.

results.title: Stonehenge
results.brief_description: A detailed and critical analysis of the anicent group of archaic rocks known as Stonehenge near Salisbury in the south of England. In the light of latest archeological discoveries at Stonehenge, the film reconstructs the ring of stones as it must have appeared after its completion between three and four thousand years ago. It also explains the origin and method of moving the blue-stones, the boulders of the outer circle and trilithons. Models are used to illustrate the probable method of erecting the stones. Finally some idea of the purpose of the complete structure is given.

results.title: Stone soup
results.creator_credit: Marcia Brown, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Tells the story of three hungry soldiers who are unable to persuade the town people to share food with them. They trick the people by brewing a large kettle to which the villagers contribute their beef and vegetables and all sit down to a banquet. Based on an old French folk tale written and illustrated by Marcia Brown.

results.title: Stone into steel
results.creator_credit: Paul Dickson, A. Frank Bundy, United Steel Companies and Wallace Productions
results.brief_description: Impressions of a large modern steel works which tell, without dialogue, the story of the making of steel from ironstone. The lives of the steelworkers themselves are also explored.
